metaTitle: 3 Bed Town House Dolores €389,000 | Costa Blanca
metaDescription: Stunning 3-bed town house in Dolores, Costa Blanca. €389,000. Premium specification, 40% less than island markets. Perfect holiday home.
heroIntro: Imagine waking up to Mediterranean sunshine, stepping out onto your own private terrace in a charming Spanish town, with golden beaches just 20 minutes away. This exceptional 3-bedroom town house in Dolores offers everything you need for the ultimate holiday home or Mediterranean escape. At €389,000, you're investing in a premium specification property at 40% less than comparable properties on Spanish islands—genuine value for a lifestyle upgrade. With 143m² of thoughtfully designed living space set on a 190m² plot, this town house delivers the perfect balance of modern comfort and authentic Spanish character. Whether you're seeking a tranquil sunshine retreat for extended family getaways, a rental investment generating €800+ per week, or a permanent escape from grey skies, this Dolores property ticks every box. The established expat community here speaks English fluently, pristine beaches are minutes away, and world-class golf courses await. This isn't just a second home—it's your gateway to the Mediterranean lifestyle you've always dreamed about.
areaSection: Dolores sits in the heart of the Costa Blanca's interior, a charming Spanish town that has remained authentic while welcoming an international community. Located in Sector 3 of Alicante province, the town enjoys genuine Spanish character without the overdevelopment of coastal resorts. The area benefits from the region's famous 320+ days of sunshine annually, with mild winters and warm summers perfect for year-round living. Dolores is positioned strategically between the vibrant coast and quieter inland landscapes, offering residents the best of both worlds. The town is known for its welcoming atmosphere, local weekly markets bursting with fresh produce, and proximity to major amenities including shopping centers and healthcare facilities. This is where Spanish tradition meets modern convenience—a place where tourists become residents, and second homes become cherished escapes.
lifestyleSection: Daily life in Dolores revolves around relaxation, sunshine, and community. Your mornings might start with strong café con leche at a local terrace, followed by a swim at one of the nearby Blue Flag beaches or a round of golf at championship courses within 15 minutes. The town's established international community means you'll hear English spoken everywhere, making integration effortless for British and foreign buyers. Weekly markets offer fresh Mediterranean produce—oranges, almonds, vegetables—at prices that make you smile. For dining, you're spoiled for choice with everything from authentic paella restaurants to international cuisine. Healthcare is excellently provided with English-speaking doctors at private clinics and a regional hospital within 30 minutes. Schools offer British curriculum options for families. Shopping is convenient with Mercadona, Lidl, and Consum supermarkets nearby. The true lifestyle here is unhurried—long lunches, afternoon siestas, evening paseos through town, and plenty of time for what matters most to you.
locationHighlights: Playa Paraíso Beach (Blue Flag) - 18 minutes drive
Las Ramblas Golf Club - 12 minutes drive
Guardamar del Segura Beach - 20 minutes drive

propertyFeatures.intro: This 3-bedroom town house combines modern comfort with authentic Spanish design, offering substantial living space with excellent layout and quality construction throughout.
features: 3 generously sized bedrooms with natural light
190m² plot with potential for terrace expansion
Spacious lounge/dining area perfect for entertaining
Flexible layout adaptable to your needs

investmentSection: This property represents intelligent investment on the Costa Blanca. Priced at €2,720/m², it commands a premium over the Dolores average of €2,200/m² due to superior specification and build quality—yet remains 40% cheaper than equivalent properties on Spanish islands like Mallorca and Ibiza. The Costa Blanca property market has experienced consistent +8% year-on-year growth, positioning this as a solid long-term asset. For holiday home buyers, the rental potential is substantial: comparable properties in the area command €800+ per week during peak season, offering realistic returns if you choose to offset ownership costs. Whether you're buying for personal use, rental income, or capital appreciation, this town house ticks all investment criteria. The established tourism infrastructure, airport proximity, and international buyer demand ensure consistent property values.

lifeAndAmenities.intro: Dolores provides all the daily conveniences you need while maintaining genuine Spanish authenticity. Everything is accessible, affordable, and designed around a relaxed Mediterranean pace of life. From healthcare to shopping, education to entertainment, your practical needs are seamlessly covered.

healthcare.text: Healthcare in the Dolores area is excellent and easily accessible for international residents. A regional hospital is positioned within 30 minutes' drive, offering comprehensive medical services and emergency care. Multiple private clinics throughout the area cater specifically to English-speaking patients, with English-speaking doctors on staff who understand the needs of international residents. Prescription medications are affordable compared to UK prices, and dental care is world-class. Many residents choose private health insurance (often under €100/month) for additional peace of mind, though EU residents can access Spanish healthcare through reciprocal agreements.
keyPoints: Regional Hospital Torrevieja - 28 minutes emergency services
Dental clinics with English-speaking staff - 4 minutes walk
Prescription medications 30-40% cheaper than UK prices

education.text: For families, educational options in the region are comprehensive. International schools operating British curriculum standards are located within 20-25 minutes, offering continuity for children moving from the UK. Spanish state schools are also excellent and fully integrated with the community. Many international residents choose bilingual education, allowing children to develop Spanish language skills while maintaining UK curriculum standards. University options across the region provide excellent secondary and tertiary education opportunities.
keyPoints: Spanish state schools - excellent standards and integration
University of Alicante - 30 minutes for higher education

shopping.text: Shopping in Dolores is convenient and pleasantly affordable. Mercadona, Lidl, and Consum supermarkets provide everything from groceries to household items at prices significantly lower than UK supermarkets. Weekly markets burst with fresh Mediterranean produce—oranges, almonds, tomatoes—at authentic Spanish prices. For larger shopping expeditions, Marina shopping center offers comprehensive retail options including clothing, electronics, and dining. Local shops maintain genuine Spanish character while stocking international products catering to the expat community.
keyPoints: Mercadona Supermarket - 2 minutes walk, full groceries
Local weekly markets - fresh produce at Spanish prices
Lidl and Consum - 5-7 minutes drive, budget shopping
Marina shopping center - 8 minutes drive, comprehensive retail

transport.text: Getting around Dolores and the Costa Blanca is straightforward. Alicante-Elche Airport is just 35 minutes away, making UK travel simple and affordable with budget airlines. Local bus connections link the town to nearby beaches and shopping centers, though most residents recommend having a car for maximum flexibility and spontaneous coastal trips. Driving in Spain is relaxed compared to UK roads, and parking in Dolores is abundant and often free. The road network is modern and well-maintained throughout the region.

keyPoints: Alicante-Elche Airport - 35 minutes flight to UK
Local bus connections - town and coastal routes
Car recommended for beach trips and flexibility
Excellent road network, relaxed driving culture

Authentic Spanish living without overdevelopment—maintain genuine culture while enjoying modern amenities

priceComparison.verdict: At €2,720/m², this property commands a modest 24% premium over Dolores average due to superior specification, representing exceptional value when compared to Spanish island markets where equivalent properties exceed €4,500/m².

buyerPersona.perfectFor: British buyers seeking a Mediterranean holiday home combining authentic Spanish living with modern comfort, reliable rental income, and easy airport access for family gatherings.

faqs.question: How much does this property cost?
faqs.answer: €389,000. This 3-bedroom town house offers premium specification at 40% less than comparable properties on Spanish islands. Payment options include cash purchases, Spanish mortgages (available to foreign buyers), and installment plans with certain developers. At €2,720/m², the price represents excellent value in the current Costa Blanca market.

faqs.question: Can foreigners buy property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. Non-EU and EU citizens can purchase property in Spain without restriction. You'll need an NIE (Spanish tax identification number), which takes approximately two weeks to obtain. British buyers post-Brexit have identical rights to EU citizens. Legal procedures are straightforward with professional legal support, typically taking 4-6 weeks from offer to completion.

faqs.question: Is Costa Blanca a good place to buy property?
faqs.answer: Yes, Costa Blanca is one of Europe's most established property markets for international buyers. Property values have appreciated +8% year-on-year, there's strong rental demand from tourism, and the established expat infrastructure makes relocation seamless. Climate, beaches, healthcare, and affordability combine to make it consistently attractive for holiday home buyers.

faqs.question: What are the costs of buying property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Beyond the purchase price, expect: transfer tax 6-10%, legal fees €1,500-3,000, notary fees €600-1,200, and registration costs €300-500. Total additional costs typically range 8-12% of purchase price. Renovation and furnishing costs vary. Annual costs include council tax (IBI) approximately €300-600/year for this property type, and optional private health insurance €60-120/month.

faqs.question: Can I get a mortgage in Spain as a foreigner?
faqs.answer: Yes, several Spanish banks offer mortgages to foreign buyers, typically up to 60-70% loan-to-value. Requirements include proof of income, stable employment history, and good credit standing. Interest rates are competitive (currently 3-4%), and terms extend to 25 years. Many British buyers find mortgages attractive for investment purchases, preserving cash while leveraging favorable rates.

faqs.question: What is the cost of living in Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca offers exceptional value compared to UK costs. Groceries are 25-35% cheaper, dining out costs €8-15 per person, utilities €80-120/month, and healthcare through private insurance €60-120/month. Overall, couples report comfortable living on €1,200-1,600/month, compared to €2,000+ in equivalent UK areas. Retirees particularly benefit from favorable pension purchasing power.

faqs.question: What is the weather like on Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Exceptional. Costa Blanca enjoys 320+ days of sunshine annually with average temperatures: 17°C in winter (December-February), 28°C in summer (June-August). Rainfall is minimal (200mm/year), primarily in autumn/spring. Sea temperature ranges 13-26°C. The climate is ideal for year-round outdoor living—beach swims March-November, comfortable temperatures for golf and walking year-round.

faqs.question: How far is Costa Blanca from the UK?
faqs.answer: Alicante-Elche Airport is just 35 minutes from this property. Direct flights to London, Manchester, and Birmingham typically cost £25-70 with budget airlines, taking 2-2.5 hours flight time. Many holiday home owners visit monthly or bi-monthly, making it accessible for regular UK contact while maintaining Mediterranean base.

faqs.question: Is Costa Blanca good for retirees?
faqs.answer: Excellent. Costa Blanca has a well-established retirement community with comprehensive healthcare, affordable cost of living, year-round sunshine, and English-speaking services everywhere. Pension income stretches further, social opportunities abound through the international community, and the relaxed lifestyle reduces stress. Many retirees report improved health and wellbeing within months of relocating.

faqs.question: What rental income can I expect from this property?
faqs.answer: Comparable 3-bedroom properties in Dolores command €800+ per week during peak season (June-September), €500-700 shoulder seasons, and €350-450 winter months. Annual gross potential exceeds €25,000-30,000. After costs (maintenance, management 20%, utilities), net returns typically reach 4-6%, comparable to UK rental yields while maintaining personal use flexibility.

At €389,000 with premium specification 40% cheaper than island alternatives, it delivers genuine value. Combine personal enjoyment with rental income potential, add year-round sunshine and Blue Flag beaches minutes away, and you have a compelling investment case. The established English-speaking community means you'll never feel isolated, while excellent healthcare and modern amenities ensure practical peace of mind. Whether this becomes your weekend escape, your retirement paradise, or your income-generating holiday home, the opportunity is yours to seize.
